definition: in no shape to be seen/unpresentable/beyond recognition
(negative prefix)/not/no
to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
manner/pattern/way/appearance/shape/classifier: kind, type

sentences.english: And her homework was covered in bites and hoof prints.
sentences.chinese: 她的作业本被啃得不像样，而且还被踩满了蹄印。

sentences.english: This skirt is in poor shape.
Please excuse this _ apology for a meal.
sentences.chinese: 请包涵这顿不像样的饭菜。

sentences.english: The animal is bald and mangy; it's an apology for a dog.
sentences.chinese: 这牲畜光秃秃的，浑身污秽，真是一条不像样的狗。

sentences.english: Yet in these times he might have done much worse.
sentences.chinese: 然则时至今日，也许更不像样。

sentences.english: The snug professional blouses that fit my bust in the morning did not fit by noon.
sentences.chinese: 早晨穿着舒适合体的职业装到中午就不像样了。

sentences.english: By Tuesday, the living room had come under the deatardly spell.
sentences.chinese: 星期二，客厅也乱得不像样，好像遭到了炸弹的袭击。

definition: shapeless/deformed/ruined/beyond recognition/(of a person) reduced to a shadow
unreasonable/shocking/outrageous
unreasonable/shocking/outrageous/also written 不像話|不像话
not according with decorum (idiom); scandalous/bad form/unacceptable behavior
see 不像話|不像话[bu4 xiang4 hua4]
seemly/presentable
to waste/to spoil/to destroy/to insult grievously
to waste/to defile/to abuse/to insult/to defile/to trample on/to wreck/also pr. [zao1 ta5]
petty/small-minded
proper/also written 像話|像话
misshapen/crooked/uneven (idiom)
ugly/shameful/to ridicule
to spoil one's appetite/fig. to get fed up with sth
unlike/in contrast to
ashamed/embarrassed/not having the face (to meet people)/not daring (out of shame)
desperately serious/disastrous/extremely/exceedingly
